sen.j: また、シャルル・シャノワーヌ大尉らフランス軍事顧問団による直接指導も導入され、その訓練を受ける伝習隊が新規に編成された。
sen.e: Direct training by French military advisors including Charles Chanoine taijo was implemented, and Denshutai (Edo shogunate's army) which was to be instructed by them was newly organized.
Direct training by French military advisors including senior lieutenant Charles Chanoine was introduced, and Denshutai (Edo shogunate's army) was newly organized to be instructed by them.

sen.e: Direct training by French military advisors including senior lieutenant Charles Chanoine was introduced, and Denshutai (Edo shogunate's army) was newly organized to be instructed by them.

sen.e: The recruiting method of soldiers was modified.

sen.j: 従来の兵賦による歩兵隊のほか、旗本に禄高ごとに銃隊を整備させて、数家分を組み合わせて小隊や大隊級の銃隊を編成する組合銃隊の制度も施行された。
sen.e: Aside from foot soldier troops based on the existing heifu, the system of corporative musket units comprising small or big musket units which consist of several families of hatamoto by having hatamoto develop musket units based on rokudaka was established.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。兵賦→定訳不明のため→heifuとしています。組合銃隊→定訳不明ですが→cooperative musket unit と訳出しています。
sen.e: Aside from existing infantry that was comprised of heifu, the system of corporative musket units was established, under which each hatamoto was obliged to consolidate a musket unit according to his rokudaka, and several musket units were combined to organize platoons or battalions.
sen.cmt: 読みにくいので文の構成を全体的に変更しました。
sen.e: Aside from existing infantry that was comprised of heifu, the system of corporative musket units was established, under which each hatamoto was obliged to consolidate a musket unit according to his rokudaka, and several musket units were combined to organize platoons or battalions.

sen.j: 組合銃隊用の兵員は、歩兵隊とは異なり、平時は各旗本の屋敷に待機することとされていた。

Unlike infantry, the solders of cooperative musket units had to stand by in the residence of each hatamoto in peacetime.
sen.cmt: 「平時は」"in peacetime"が抜けていたので補いました。
sen.e: Unlike infantry, the solders of cooperative musket units had to stand by in the residence of each hatamoto in peacetime.

sen.j: しかし、翌1866年1月に、兵賦については金納をもって替え、その資金で幕府が直接に雇用する形態となった（幕府歩兵隊の傭兵化）。
sen.e: However, in January 1866, the system of heifu changed, and heifu was paid by cash, and bakufu foot soldier troop was hired by bakufu which received the cash (the bakufu foot soldier troop became a mercenary).
However, in January 1866, the system of heifu was abolished and hatamoto paid cash instead of heifu, and bakufu directly hired soldiers with the cash (the bakufu infantry became a mercenary).

sen.e: However, in January 1866, the system of heifu was abolished and hatamoto paid cash instead of heifu, and bakufu directly hired soldiers with the cash (the bakufu infantry became a mercenary).

sen.j: さらに同年9月に組合銃隊についても、幕府の財政事情などから金納による歩兵隊へと変更された。
sen.e: Cooperative musket units was changed to foot soldier troops (infantry) that are paid by cash due to the financial circumstances of bakufu in September in the same year.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Furthermore, in September of the same year, cooperative musket units were changed to infantry hired using the cash paid by hatamoto due to the financial circumstances of bakufu.

sen.e: Furthermore, in September of the same year, cooperative musket units were changed to infantry hired using the cash paid by hatamoto due to the financial circumstances of bakufu.

Each hatamoto was obliged to pay the half of koso (annual tax).
Each hatamoto was obliged to pay the half of koso (annual tax).

sen.j: 最終時点で、幕府陸軍は歩兵隊8個連隊（一橋徳川家の播磨領で第16連隊が編成されて、計9個連隊であるとも言われる。）と伝習歩兵隊3個大隊を中核に、日本最大の西洋式軍事組織となっていた。
sen.e: Eventually, the bakufu rikugun became the largest western-style military organization in Japan, centering on 8 regiments of foot soldier troop and 3 battalion of learning foot soldier troops (it is said that it should be 9 regiments as the sixteenth regiment was established in the territory of Harima of Hitosubashi Tokugawa family).
sen.cmt: 本列は後列と一文であると考えられるため結合し訳出しました。伝習歩兵隊→定訳不明ですが→learning foot soldier troops と訳出しています。
sen.e: Eventually, the bakufu rikugun became the largest western-style military organization in Japan, centering on 8 regiments of infantry and 3 battalion of learning infantry (some sais that it should be 9 regiments as the sixteenth regiment was established in the territory of Harima of Hitotsubashi Tokugawa family).

Eventually, the bakufu rikugun became the largest western-style military organization in Japan, centering on 8 regiments of infantry and 3 battalion of learning infantry (some sais that it should be 9 regiments as the sixteenth regiment was established in the territory of Harima of Hitotsubashi Tokugawa family).
